About Contact

About

The Seabase project is made possible by a grant from the Prince Albert II of Monaco Fondation.
Seasbase is a website using gage, a configuration framework for producing "G"enomic "P"ages. It wraps [jBrowse 1](https://jbrowse.org/jbrowse1.html) and SequenceServer in website generated by a Jekyl wrapper. A build script faciliates data and metadata validation and staging.

Citing

This website

  • SeaBase GAGE Portal - . Version generated on 22/12/14.

Component software

  • SequenceServer - Priyam et al. (2019) Sequenceserver: a modern graphical user interface for custom BLAST databases.
  • jBrowse (1.6.x) - Buels R et al. JBrowse: a dynamic web platform for genome visualization and analysis.Genome Biology (2016).

Gage

  • Gage is open source software, source is here.

Technical

These pages are built with Gage, a configuration framework for producing Genomic Pages.

    SeaBase is made possible by a grant from the Prince Albert II of Monaco Foundation to David Mark Welch at the Marine Biological Laboratory
